ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Store bought JBoots
ygData.msgSnippet: They are live. I am reading on the EQ Boards, that they do not have to be worn to be activated. These went to the live with yesterday s patch. ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
They are live. I am reading on the EQ Boards, that they do not have to be
worn to be activated. These went to the live with yesterday's patch.


-----Original Message-----
From: Danspath [SMTP:danspth@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 09, 2001 1:10 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Store bought JBoots

Are these availble on test only or did they go live in the patch?

Too bad for all those shaman that used to be able to sell sow juice
to high end characters


"Nygaard, Jeff" <jnygaard@...> wrote:


Anyone know if the new Traveler Boots must be worn to cast?

I know they are sold in Sol A

Same vender and price as Tinkers Bag, 5,250 plat

They have 1 AC

They have 1.5 cast time

They are lore and heard no drop, not sure about this though.

Anyone here know if they must be worn to cast the effect?

Thanks!


-----Original Message-----
From: Su [SMTP:suceress@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 2:24 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Taunt Macro


Is the ability number the hotk! ey number or the
ability in some s ort
of list?
luv,
-Su

> I do not have a warrior, but I do have a bard that I
made a track
macro
for and it should be a similar process. I think Taunt
falls under
the
category of a doability. Here is a definition from a
website I use:
>
> /doability # - Causes player to perform the special
ability
specified by
number. For example, if Lay On Hands if your
characters 4th ability
(1-6 are
the 6 general abilities, while 7-10 are the 4 combat
abilities
besides Melee
and Ranged.), /doability 4 would perform the Lay on
Hands.
>
> So, ! a taunt macro could go like this:< BR> >
> /g Taunting %t onto me
> /doability 7(or whatever number it ends up being)
>
>
> The /g tells your group what you are doing. The
/doability #
performs the
taunt. It should work. Good luck.
>
> BTW, here is a site one of my bard friends Tallies
keeps up that
has lots
of good information:
>
> http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqcommands.htm
<http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqcommands.htm>
>
> Watch out for word wrap when you cl! ick the link.
; >
> Robiinton Masterhealer
> Piemur Draggonsinger
>
